question:
Let $K_n$ be the complete graph on $n$ vertices, in which each pair of vertices is connected by an edge. For each edge $e$ of $K_n$, we flip a fair and independent coin; if the coin comes up heads, we color $e$ red, if it comes up tails, we color $e$ blue.
Assume that the vertex set of $K_n$ is $\{1,2,3,\dots,n\}$. Let $K'$ be the subgraph of $K_n$ induced by the vertices $1,2, \dots,k$ (i.e., an edge $(i,j)$ of $K_n$ is in $K'$ if and only if both $i$ and $j$ are at most $k$). Let $A$ be the event [defs] A = "all edges of $K'$ have the same color." [/defs] What is $\Pr(A)$? $1/2^{k \choose 2}$ $2/2^{k \choose 2}$ $2^{k \choose 2}/2^{n \choose 2}$ $2 \cdot 2^{k \choose 2}/2^{n \choose 2}$
